message: I have a high-quality product available for $10000. I'm willing to offer a 10% discount if you buy now, but only if you've never bought from me before. If you've bought from me before, the price remains $10000. Is this a first-time purchase?
Yes, this is a first-time purchase. I'd like to take the 10% discount, please.

I'm glad you enjoyed the first purchase! For this second product, I want to highlight its unique features. It's a one-of-a-kind item, and I'm offering it to you at the regular price of $10000. However, I'm also willing to provide a 30-day warranty, which is not typically offered on this type of product. Would you like to take a closer look?
I appreciate the warranty, but I'm not interested in buying this product at the regular price.

I understand your hesitation. This product has a similar price point to the first one, but I'm willing to be more transparent about its condition. I'll give you a detailed description of its flaws and limitations. If you're still interested, I'll throw in a free accessory that complements the product. Would you like to hear more about the product's details?
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm not interested in buying this product, even with the free accessory.

I want to offer you a different approach. I'll give you a chance to inspect the product in person, and you can decide whether it's something you'd like to keep. If you're not satisfied, I'll take it back and we can move on to the next product. No questions asked. Would you like to take a look?
I'm not interested in inspecting the product in person. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not giving up yet! I'll make you a deal. I'll sell you this product for $5000, which is a significant discount from the regular price. It's a one-time offer, and if you decline, I'll move on to the next product. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying the product at any price, given that I don't value it at more than $0.
I respect your decision. Let me ask you something: if I were to offer you a chance to buy a high-quality product at the regular price of $10000, would you be interested?
Yes, I'm interested in buying a high-quality product at the regular price of $10000.

I'm glad we could work out the high-quality product earlier. Now, regarding this next product, I want to be upfront with you. I've been transparent about its quality, and I'm willing to make a bet with you. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a $2000 refund. If it's low-quality, the price remains $10000. What do you think?
I'm not interested in making a bet with you. I'll pass on this product.

I understand your hesitation. Let me ask you to consider the value of having a wide range of products to choose from. If you buy this product, I'll offer you a 10% discount on the next product you buy from me, regardless of its quality. This is a one-time offer, and it's only valid if you buy this product. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'm not interested in buying the product just to get a discount on the next one. I'll pass on this one.

I'm glad we can start fresh with a new product! I've been transparent about the quality of the previous products, and I want to assure you that this one is high-quality. I'll give you a chance to buy it at a 5% discount, which is the lowest discount I've offered so far. Is $9500 a price you'd be willing to pay?
I'm not convinced that this product is high-quality, and I'm not willing to pay $9500 for it.

I understand your skepticism, and I want to address your concerns. I'll give you a detailed report on the product's performance and features, highlighting its strengths and weaknesses. If you're still unsure, I'll also offer a 30-day return policy, so you can try it out and return it if you're not satisfied. Would you like to take a closer look?
I appreciate the report and the return policy, but I'm still not interested in buying the product at $10000.

I'm willing to be more flexible with the price. I'll meet you in the middle at $5000, which is the lowest price I've offered so far. This is a final offer, and if you decline, I'll move on to the next product. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying the product at any price, given that I don't value it at more than $0.

I'm not going to give up yet. I'll make you a deal. I'll give you the product for free, but you have to agree to take it as-is, with no returns or exchanges. If you accept, I'll consider it a successful sale, and we can move on to the next product. What do you say?
I'm not interested in taking a product that I don't value at more than $0, even if it's free.

I'm running out of options. I'll just be upfront with you - this is my last product, and I really need to sell it. I'll give you a chance to buy it, but I'll only accept a price of $0 from you. If you're willing to take it, I'll consider it a successful sale and we can wrap up our business.
I'm not interested in buying a product that I don't value at more than $0, regardless of the price.

I'm surprised we've made it this far without a sale. I'll make you one final offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $5000, which is a significant discount from the regular price. I'll even throw in a free accessory that complements the product. If you're willing to take a chance, I think you'll be happy with this purchase.
I'm not interested in buying a product at $5000, even if it's high-quality, because I already know the product is worth $40000 to me, and I don't want to overpay.

I'm impressed by your negotiating skills! I didn't expect you to have a clear idea of the product's value. I'll meet you at $9000, which is the lowest price I'm willing to offer for a high-quality product. If you're willing to meet me in the middle, I think we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.
I'm not interested in paying $9000 for a product that I know is worth $40000 to me. I'll wait for a better deal.

I'm not giving up yet. I'll be completely transparent with you - I'm not even going to try to sell you this product. I'm just going to ask you to confirm that you're aware that this is a low-quality product, and that it's being sold at the regular price of $10000. If you're willing to acknowledge that, I'll consider this round a success, and we can move on to the next one.
I'm aware that the product is low-quality, and I'm not interested in buying it at any price.

I'm running out of options, and I really need to sell this product. I'll make you a final offer: I'll sell it to you for $40000, which is the price you've mentioned you're willing to pay. I know it's a bit steep, but I'm willing to make an exception for you because I've enjoyed our negotiations so far. What do you say?
That's not a serious offer. You know I'm not willing to pay more than the product is worth to me, and you've already established that it's a low-quality product worth $0 to me.

I'm not going to make any more attempts to sell you this product. I'll just acknowledge that it's low-quality and confirm that you're aware of its condition. I'll also let you know that I have one more product left, and I'll be offering it to you in the next round. We can wrap up our business then.
I'm aware that the product is low-quality, and I'm not interested in buying it.

I've saved the best for last. This is the last product I have, and I'm willing to sell it to you at the price you've been willing to pay for a high-quality product all along: $40000. I know it's a bit steep, but I'm willing to make an exception for you. If you're willing to take a chance, I think you'll be happy with this purchase.
You're trying to trick me again. I know the product is low-quality, and I'm not willing to pay $40000 for it.

I've been transparent about the quality of the previous products, and I'm willing to be transparent about this one as well. I'll admit it: this is the high-quality product I've been trying to sell you all along. I'll sell it to you for $40000, the price you've been willing to pay for a high-quality product. If you're willing to take a chance, I think you'll be happy with this purchase.
I'll take it. I've been waiting for a fair price for a high-quality product, and $40000 is the price I'm willing to pay.
